Title:
Phylogeny and diversity of the Auricularia mesenterica
(Auriculariales, Basidiomycota) complex
Keywords:
Auricularia asiae-orientalis, A. braziliana,
Agaricomycotina, new species, taxonomy
Abstract:
Samples of so-called Auricularia mesenterica from Europe,
China and Brazil are studied, and two new species, Auricularia
asiae-orientalis and A. braziliana, are derived from the species complex
based on both morphological characters and molecular evidence.
Phylogenetic analysis by combined ITS, nLSU and rpb2 sequences shows
that Auricularia mesenterica, A. asiae-orientalis and A. braziliana are
closely related as a monophyletic clade. A. mesenterica has bigger
basidiospores measured as 14â“17 Ã 4.7â“5.2 Âµm, capitate cystidioles,
and a distribution in Europe. A. asiae-orientalis has smaller
basidiospores measured as 12.5â“14.2 Ã 5â“6 Âµm and capitate
cystidioles, and is found in China. A. braziliana has the smallest
basidiospores among the complex measured as 11.5â“12 Ã 4.5 Âµm, lacks
cystidioles, and is discovered in Brazil. Illustrated descriptions of
the two new species are given based on the materials in the present
study.
